description: Calculate the perimeter of islands in a 2D grid

test_cases.name: Example 1 - Complex island
test_cases.explanation: The perimeter is calculated by counting all edges that border water or the boundary

test_cases.name: Single cell island
test_cases.explanation: A single cell has 4 edges, all touching the boundary

test_cases.name: No islands
test_cases.explanation: No land cells means perimeter is 0

test_cases.name: Full grid
test_cases.explanation: Only external edges count as perimeter

hints: Count edges that touch water or boundary
For each land cell, check all 4 directions
Alternative: count total land cells * 4, then subtract internal edges * 2
